references.paper_title: Finite-time analysis of the multiarmed bandit problem
references.reason: This paper provides the foundational finite-time analysis of the classic multi-armed bandit problem, which is central to the understanding of delayed feedback bandits.

references.paper_title: Delay and cooperation in nonstochastic bandits
references.reason: This work is crucial because it analyzes the adversarial multi-armed bandit problem with delayed feedback, providing both lower and upper bounds which are directly relevant to the current paper.

references.paper_title: Tsallis-INF: An optimal algorithm for stochastic and adversarial bandits
references.reason: This paper introduces the Tsallis-INF algorithm, which is modified and extended in the current paper to handle delayed feedback with robustness to excessive delays.
This paper is foundational for understanding best-of-both-worlds algorithms in the context of delayed feedback, providing a key theoretical foundation for the current research.

references.paper_title: A best-of-both-worlds algorithm for bandits with delayed feedback
references.reason: This paper represents the most directly related prior work, providing a best-of-both-worlds algorithm for delayed bandits that the current paper improves upon by enhancing robustness to excessive delays.
